name: Adonis vernalis
Relationship: ADONIDIN is a cardiac tonic and diuretic. Quarter grain daily, or two to five grains of first decimal trit. increases arterial pressure and prolongs the diastole, favoring emptying engorged veins. Is an excellent substitute for Digitalis and is not cumulative in action.Compare: Digit.; Crataegus.; Conval.; Strophanthus.

Heart: Myocarditis, irregular cardiac action, constriction and vertigo
Head: Feels light; aches across font, FROM OCCIPUT AROUND TEMPLES TO EYES
Vertigo on rising, turning head quickly or lying down
Tinnitus
Scalp feels tight
Eyes dilated
Respiratory: Frequent desire to take a long breath
Mouth: Tongue dirty yellow, sore, feels scalded

details: A heart medicine, after rheumatism or influenza, or Bright's disease, where the muscles of the heart are in stage of fatty degeneration, regulating the pulse and increasing the power of contractions of heart, with increased urinary secretions. Most valuable in cardiac dropsy. Low vitality, with weak heart and slow, weak pulse. Feeble heart action due only to functional disturbance. Hydrothorax, ascites. Anasarca.
dosage: Five to ten drops of the tincture.
